item.title: Kirby Embroidery
item.description: During the quarantine summer, I started learning embroidery! The first peice I did was a knife Kirby saying “Have yowo heawd about teh LOWOD?” It was my first free-hand embroidery, I had to look up specific stitches! Here’s a link to a YouTube video I referenced. Kirby embroidery

item.title: R and Python
item.description: Here’s just some code I took from Worksheet 21: library(reticulate) py_config() ## python: /stor/home/mgb2576/.local/share/r-miniconda/envs/r-reticulate/bin/python ## libpython: /stor/home/mgb2576/.local/share/r-miniconda/envs/r-reticulate/lib/libpython3.6m.so ## pythonhome: /stor/home/mgb2576/.local/share/r-miniconda/envs/r-reticulate:/stor/home/mgb2576/.local/share/r-miniconda/envs/r-reticulate ## version: 3.6.13 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Feb 19 2021, 05:36:01) [GCC 9.3.0] ## numpy: /stor/home/mgb2576/.local/share/r-miniconda/envs/r-reticulate/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy ## numpy_version: 1.19.5 py_install("pandas") py_install("matplotlib") matplotlib <- import("matplotlib") matplotlib$use("Agg", force = TRUE) import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import pandas x=np.random.normal(0,1,50) y=np.random.normal(0,1,50) plt.scatter(x,y) library(ggplot2) ggplot()+geom_point(aes(py$x,py$y)) Conversation Here’s some Python code saving various variables for my made up persoanlity of a character, “Python”:

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis (SDS348)
item.description: knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, eval = TRUE, fig.align = "center", warning = F, message = F, tidy=TRUE, tidy.opts=list(width.cutoff=60), R.options=list(max.print=100)) Introduction For my project, I initially wanted to see what kind of effect COVID-19, particularly the lockdowns, had affected people’s everyday lives and activities. The datasets I chose were posted on www.statista.com and they’re all based in Norway. The COVID cases, new and cumulative, were both published by Connor Stewart, a researcher who focuses on health and pharmaceuticals in Europe, and the data was sourced from Folkehelseinstituttet (FHI), the Institute of Public Health in Norway.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting (SDS348) | It's ya boi, Norway again
item.description: knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, eval = TRUE, fig.align = "center", warning = F, message = F, tidy = TRUE, tidy.opts = list(width.cutoff = 60), R.options = list(max.print = 100)) Introduction In this project, Norway, once again, shall be the focus. Here, I’ve retrieved 3 online data sets: Power Consumption, Coronavirus Pandemic Country Profile, and Mobility. The Power Consumption data set recorded hourly power consumption in megawatts (MW) for 15 European countries, and was uploaded by François Raucent on www.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Check out some of my coding projects below: Wrangling & Exploratory Data Analysis Modeling, Inference, Prediction --
